page.title: 18MARCHAM MILL
page.content: Marcham Mill is mentioned in Domesday Book, but Mrs Jones who lives there told us there was a Saxon mill called {Wulfmere's Mill}. Wulf was a pike. Later the mill was called {Wergen Mill}, wergen means willow. The mill used to grind corn. It stopped about 1900. The spring at the mill is salty even though the mill is 60 miles from the sea. The people who lived there had to get their water from the village. A lot of the flowers are saltwater ones. One of them is wild celery. The name Marcham means the "riverside where the wild celery grows"
